tn.ref: In the seventh month on the twenty-first day of the month
tn.text: first day of the month** - This is the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. The twenty-first day is near the middle of October on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]]).

tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came
tn.text: "Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:hag:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: came by the hand of Haggai
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]]).

tn.ref: Haggai ... Zerubbabel ... Shealtiel ... Jehozadak
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]).

tn.ref: Is it not like nothing in your eyes?
tn.text: "You must certainly think it is not important at all." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]]).

tn.ref: Now, be strong
tn.text: "From now on be strong,"

tn.ref: shake the heavens and the earth
tn.text: a very great disturbance.

tn.ref: The silver and gold are mine!
tn.text: The words "silver and gold" refer to the treasures brought to the temple.

tn.ref: In the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month
tn.text: fourth day of the ninth month** - This is the ninth month of the Hebrew calendar. The twenty-fourth day is near the middle of December on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: in the second year of Darius
tn.text: "in the second year of the reign of Darius" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: Darius ... Haggai
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came
tn.text: "Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:hag:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: So it is with this people and this nation before me!
tn.text: "This is true with the people of Israel!" or "This same principle holds true for the people of Israel!"

tn.ref: twenty measures
tn.text: A "measure" is an unknown amount. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]]).

tn.ref: fifty measures
tn.text: A "measure" is an unknown amount. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]]).

tn.ref: I afflicted you and all the work of your hands
tn.text: "I cursed your labor and all your crops". (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]]).

tn.ref: the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month
tn.text: fourth day of the ninth month** - See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:hag:02:10|2:10]].

tn.ref: Is there still seed in the storehouse?
tn.text: The expected answer is 'no'. This question is used to highlight what the readers already knew. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]]).

tn.ref: the fig tree, the pomegranate, and the olive tree
tn.text: These are fruits grown in the land.

tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came
tn.text: "Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:hag:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Haggai ... Zerubbabel
tn.text: These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: on the twenty-fourth day of the month
tn.text: fourth day of the month** - AT: "on the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: I will shake the heavens and the earth
tn.text: Yahweh will cause disruption in their world.

tn.ref: the heavens and the earth
tn.text: AT: "the whole universe"

tn.ref: For I will overthrow the throne of kingdoms
tn.text: Governments will fall apart in the chaos.

tn.ref: the throne of kingdoms
tn.text: AT: "government ruled by kings"

tn.ref: brother's sword
tn.text: AT: "the sword on a fellow soldier"

tn.ref: Zerubbabel ... Shealtiel
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
